Ratings.comment: very information and vocab heavy, the multiple choice on the exams are very surface level, just identifying plant structures. very lab heavy, the lab TAs are really nice. only 3 exams including the final and make sure to start studying earlier because there is so much info and don't go off her study guides she puts way too much stuff on them.

Thought that this class was going to be easy. Was not. Tests are so hard and have nothing to do with what she puts on the study guides. Start studying early and start studying a lot because the tests are ridiculous. They cover so much information, there really isn't enough time in the day to fully prepare you for these exams.

Took this class thinking it would be pretty easy, but hooo boy the amount of studying required to understand what is going on. Knows her stuff but is basically just a biology class. Midterms make up majority of grade and each one covers vast amounts of information. By no means an easy A, or B.

SEI.Subject: HCS
SEI.Class Name: Form and Function in Cultivated Plants

SEI.Subject: HCS
SEI.Class Name: Form and Function in Cultivated Plants

SEI.Subject: HCS
SEI.Class Name: Form and Function in Cultivated Plants

SEI.Subject: HCS
SEI.Class Name: Form and Function in Cultivated Plants

SEI.Subject: HCS
SEI.Class Name: Form and Function in Cultivated Plants

Ratings.comment: She doesn't put in her syllabus that every lecture needs to be watched fully for a last minute big grade. Her labs drag on and grades hard
What can I say? I got a B here. You never want to take her class if you really care about your GPA.
wouldn't take this professor if you procrastinate, love plants, wanna be happy etc....
Stay away from her…..

I don't understand why she made a class that should have been easy so difficult. I took this class just to learn how to care for plants, not to end up with a B+. I threw away the plants I had been growing. From now on, I will never grow plants again since they can ONLY remind me of an unreasonable professor and a boring class.
Avoid her. RUN! You get your gpa deducted by a general class! No need to do so. RUN!

Wendy is a good person in life but obviously not such at school. I have to finish this class for my HCS minor. However, what I met is a tough grader and tons of homework. Don't believe the five star she received earlier. This class is too hard to be an entry class for HCS students because of Wendy. HCS has become a nightmare with her.

Let me calculate your score for you. The average score for ‘class engagement' is 10/35. The total points are 350. So if technically you get 325/350 if we suppose you get other part all correct. Which means you get an A- (92.8%) at the beginning of class. She doesn't round up any grade. If you wanna get A- as your best score, go for it. :)

I had a 99.5% in the class until the last day of semester, where creates a 'course engagement' assignment that dropped me a letter grade. Everyone else I know had the same thing happen to them. Her grading system is inherently deceptive, especially for a gened class. I don't know why any professor would create such an unfair and misleading system.

I wouldn't wish this professor on my worst enemy. This is meant to be a fun class however Wendy makes it unbearable. Beware of the videos that were never stated as mandatory, she'll tank your grade at the end of the semester for not watching them. She brags about her dead plants and not so nice house. The end of course eval isn't anonymous BTW.

honestly i had an A in the class the whole time but she made a “class engagement” grade and didn't even specify that the lecture videos were mandatory and the average was like a 10/35 pls don't take this class if you wanna raise your gpa or something save yourself the trouble.

Dr. Klooster doesn't provide constructive criticism, is an unduly harsh grader for the content of her course, and is inaccessible for students outside of class. WATCH ALL LECTURE VIDEOS even though she never states them as mandatory, at the end of the semester she makes it a surprise grade and it may tank your course grade if you aren't careful.

While Dr. Klooster is extremely knowledgeable, this class was incredibly difficult for a 7-week, 2 credit hour class. Not to mention you have to watch 8+ hours of lecture videos a week and you get graded on if you watched them or not. I simply do not have that kind of time, I got a 7/35 on "course engagement", dropped me from an A+ to a B+. Insane.

I have never had a professor be so specific with grading without giving feedback. She takes points off for any and everything, the class average is extremely low for an "easy" class. Part of your grade is "class engagement" where you have to watch hours upon hours of boring lecture without being able to check your history, the average was 10/35...

This course was supposed to be a really easy fun class, but she made it too hard and unbearable. There was multiple video and slides that were so hard to understand. the feedbacks aren't clear enough to let you know what you did wrong.

A fun and excitable professor who really knows a lot, she made this class very interactive and took the class around the campus and city for labs. A harsh grader, give all written assignments 150% and if you think you've done enough, do more.

This should be an easy and fun class but Dr. Klooster makes it unbearable. Growing the plant was fun but then you get nailed on simple things like powerpoint formatting for final project. Who thought someone could take  precious plants and butcher the process of learning about it. Monotone voice. Drags lectures way too much. Brags about her house

The class is itself is not so difficult, but with the way the teacher grades makes the class unbearable. You will be criticized at any opportunity and deduced points for it. Reports, Quizzes, and Discussion Posts are not hard, but the grading feels unfair. If you take the class, but just be weary of your work and keep it 100.

Terrible course. Introductory course but will have you spending MANY hours per week doing this. Grades VERY harshly as well. I regret taking this course, I wanted to learn more about plants and this professor sucked all the fun out of it and now I'm just worried about my grade.

An unreasonable amount of work for a plant parenting and 1000-level course. Over three hours of lectures per week, supplementary readings, discussions, progress reports, a final test, a final paper, and group reviews. While the information presented is intriguing, the constant assignments and their organization are disappointing. I can't recommend.

She grades very harshly on discussion posts. This course is very lecture heavy and she has embedded questions into the lectures which you are graded on. It is sometimes unclear what you're supposed to be learning and she will often say the wrong things and then correct herself which is confusing. To say I'm annoyed is an understatement.

I am and educator taking Wendy's course for fun. There is no clarity or organization in which the material is presented. Longwinded and rambling lectures, and often will teach/say the wrong thing , then correct herself- which is confusing. She said the course isn't a "blow off" course, but it seems like she's "blowing off" teaching it.

Dr. Klooster is a highly intelligent professor who teaches all of her classes in a way that benefits the students in the long run. I think many people take her courses and expect to slack off and get an easy A, but in reality, you have to apply the regular amount of effort to pass. I think she is kind and hardworking, and she's also a great mentor.

Dr. Klooster was not always clear about her assignments/ tests, but it was one of the first courses she has taught. She was understanding and kind, as long as you worked hard and put in the effort. I think if she doesnt improve in describing exactly what she is looking for, a student would benefit from always asking questions and double-checking.
tough class, confusing to understand, different class from any other taken in college yet

Professor doesn't know how to teach - looks like a deer in the headlights every times she talks in front of the class. The class is a waste of time - very similar to watching a youtube video. Bad teacher, got other people who knew what they were talking about to guest lecture the entire time instead of putting in the work to learn the material.

SEI.Subject: HCS
SEI.Class Name: Plant Propagation: The Manipulation of Plant Reproduction

Ratings.comment: She is very helpful. Instead of giving me bad grades, she gave recommendations for improvement so I could re-do specific portions on assignments, leading to an A. The class is computer programming heavy. It's not easy to teach this to non-computer science majors, yet the instructor made it very accessible, and shared all her code.

SEI.Subject: FDSCTE
SEI.Class Name: Phytochemicals in Human Health: Crops to the Clinic

SEI.Subject: HCS
SEI.Class Name: Methods in Horticulture and Crop Science

SEI.Subject: HCS
SEI.Class Name: Methods in Horticulture and Crop Science

SEI.Subject: HCS
SEI.Class Name: Current Topics in Horticulture and Crop Science

SEI.Subject: HCS
SEI.Class Name: Current Topics in Horticulture and Crop Science

Ratings.comment: Professor Guba is a great guy who truly cares for his students! He was always upbeat each morning and willing to answer any questions thoroughly. This class is centered around one massive improvement project (No Exams!), so pray you are placed in a good group. If not, Professor Guba is happy to help. Lastly, go to class! He takes Tophat for a grade

SEI.Subject: BUSMGT
SEI.Class Name: MBOE Change & Innovation for Ops Excellence

SEI.Subject: BUSOBA
SEI.Class Name: MBOE Change & Innovation for Ops Excellence

Ratings.comment: Was told this was the easiest class I could take and it was not. Will take off points for the smallest of things and makes you work harder to get what should be an easy A compared to other GEs I have taken. There is not many assignments and her TAs do all the grading but it was just harder than it should have been. Time consuming.

Her TAs do everything for her and hardly respond to emails. Multiple assignments that were supposed to be available halfway through the semester weren't created until the last week of the class. The lecture video and notes didn't really help with the quizzes. No exams.

Ms. Sherratt is the sweetest. I did not need this class, I just wanted to take it because it interested me and she made it worth the extra space in my schedule. Her lectures are very bearable to sit through and she is so obviously obsessed with her field. If you have her in person, you might even get a little present at the end of the semester.
Easy Class.Neither the professor nor the TA reply to emails:)))))))
Easy A, weekly participation post and very little assignments. Take good notes and complete the assignments on time you will be in good shape.

Pam was such a good lecturer. She always kept her lectures interesting. Her lectures cover everything on the quiz, and theyre quite nice to listen to because of her British accent. I really enjoyed her class.

Loved her! This class is online quizzes based on lecture videos that has no due dates. The entire course is due before the end of the semester at your own pace. Dr. Sherratt send emails frequently and offered some incredibly simple ways to get extra credit. She also has a nice British accent so the videos are nice to listen to, even sped up :)
Pam is very kind and informative - and extremely responsive! The course is helpful for your GPA and also enjoyable; I strongly recommend taking if you have open room in your schedule.

Pam is a very nice person and a good teacher. Class is very boring but if you show up you'll get an A. This is probably one of the easiest classes offered at OSU, great to take if you need a GE during a brutal semester. Definitely take this for your biological science GE. Cram and forget is the name of the game for the quizzes and the midterm.

Honestly Pam is one of the nicest professors at osu. She is super interested in what she teaches and gives you every resource to succeed. Although some aspects of the course seemed unstructured like the field trips and having to watch other students present often (boring). Overall A+ for the teacher and the course.

This class was not that difficult and I was able to complete it in a couple of days. If you want a GPA booster, I would recommend this course. However, the class was not that interesting and the videos can drag on.
I will say it is a good class for bio GE require. There are 4 online quiz instead of exams.
Took this online as a 7 week course. I finished it in 3 days. Everything is due by the end of the semester. Would take this if you want an easy online course.

Sherratt is a friendly person, and she enjoys what she teaches. Tests are all online and can be vague and specific, but answers are in the powerpoint. It's beneficial to go to class, but attendance isn't recorded unless she warns ahead of time.

Class is easy, go for it but don't ask her any questions. She is not a professor that is willing to help students. When I tried to figure what questions I did wrong during quiz she refused to answer and said my question is not a "real problem". Well I don't know what a "real problem" can be

Easy A. We were in class maybe half of the semester. Took tours of some pretty interesting places on campus, including THE SHOE. Tests are all online. Death by powerpoint,  all the information is there. NO BOOK. Super simple if you do a little work. Takes attendance for credit a few times (randomly). She's always willing to help, IF u communicate.

Very boring and expects you to know things that are not made clear. She was very nice inside of class, but wasn't nice outside of class. I'd make sure to make some buddies in class to ask questions if you decide to take this. It could be an easy A if you don't mind bad teachers

Really great professor! Interesting information and she is obviously passionate about teaching. Easy exams all online and the powerpoint were all online too. Downfall, the lecture did drag on at times and you can pass the tests by looking at the ppt slides.

I absolutely love Pamela Sherratt! I could listen to her wonderful British accent for days and days. In addition to having a wonderful voice, she is an extremely good instructor. She is fantastically knowledgeable and eager to answer any questions students may have. If you have the chance to take one of her classes, DO IT!!!

Hands down best teacher iI have ever had at ohio state. so passionate about plant pathology and mushrooms. he is a super cool guy. 3 exams all with reviews. 3 or 4 quizzes. all you have to read is a couple of chapters from a book for the exams.

Chris teaches the majority of the 350-series for PGM majors at OSU. Super nice guy, really laid back and likes to joke during classes. His classes are based on mostly out-dated PGA of America info, but that will likely change with the PGM 2.0 program being instituted. Testing is vastly based on memorization. Great prep for PGA testing!

Ratings.comment: He's a good professor, knows what he's doing from a lot of experience. There's a lot of material in the class which makes for pretty large amount of content for each midterm.
Easy, fun class. Attendance is 1/3 of your grade! If you have a good grade towards the end of the semester you can opt out of the final exam! She is a great teacher and communicates material well.
Most influential prof I ever had. Deep and committed cannot be mistaken for others inability to follow logic. Thank you again.

Horrible Teacher. Class is video linked so he will never come to columbus and your forced to listen to his nonsense over the internet.  Its very hard to pay attention when the material is unorganized and the the professor doesn't make himself available to students at all.

He's really into what he does and has hands on experience in his field. If you're interested in growing fruits, you will be really interested in his lectures. If not, they can be a little long-winded. He has no real concept of time. Not a big deal when we get out of class 10 minutes late, but when we get back from a field trip 1.5 hours late....=(

Great professor, she tries to keep things interesting/fun for her students. and I ended up actually enjoying the class. you have to keep up with the work, but if you do it, you should end up with a good grade.
Not organized,this class has testing via carmen. The entire class should be on line. there is nothing added to the weekly class at all
Not a good teacher.  Her lectures are dull, she reads right off the powerpoint, and the questions on her study guides are not even on the test.  DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR, she's awful.
